channel.title: Yahoo! News - Latest News & Headlines
channel.description: The latest news and headlines from Yahoo! News. Get breaking news stories and in-depth coverage with videos and photos.

item.title: Recovery next year for world stocks: poll
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - World stock markets will recover next year from a nightmarish 2011 that has wiped trillions of dollars off share prices, according to a Reuters poll that showed almost all major stock indexes ending 2011 in the red.
item.media:text: LONDON (Reuters) - World stock markets will recover next year from a nightmarish 2011 that has wiped trillions of dollars off share prices, according to a Reuters poll that showed almost all major stock indexes ending 2011 in the red.

item.title: Syrian regime supporters pelt US envoy with eggs
item.description: Angry supporters of President Bashar Assad's regime hurled tomatoes and eggs at the U.S. ambassador to Syria on Thursday as he entered the office of a leading opposition figure and then tried to break into the building, trapping him inside for three hours.
item.media:text: Angry supporters of President Bashar Assad's regime hurled tomatoes and eggs at the U.S. ambassador to Syria on Thursday as he entered the office of a leading opposition figure and then tried to break into the building, trapping him inside for three hours.

item.title: Guard: Jackson doc collected vials before 911 call
item.description: One of Michael Jackson's bodyguards had barely stepped into the singer's bedroom when he heard a scream: "Daddy!" Jackson's young daughter cried.
item.media:text: One of Michael Jackson's bodyguards had barely stepped into the singer's bedroom when he heard a scream: "Daddy!" Jackson's young daughter cried.

item.title: Why Obama wants a Supreme Court fight on health reform in 2012
item.description: The Obama administration's decision late Monday not to ask for a full court review of the August decision by two appeals court judges to strike down ObamaCare is a risky but potentially high-value play by the White House in the legal battle over health care reform.
item.media:text: The Obama administration's decision late Monday not to ask for a full court review of the August decision by two appeals court judges to strike down ObamaCare is a risky but potentially high-value play by the White House in the legal battle over health care reform.

item.title: State Department: U.S. envoy to Syria safe after confronted by mob
item.description: The United States ambassador to Syria, Robert Ford, and embassy staff are safe after being violently confronted by a pro-regime mob while Ford met with an opposition politician in Damascus, the State Department said Thursday. "A crowd of demonstrators tried to assault Ambassador Ford and Embassy colleagues today as they went about doing the normal [...]
item.media:text: The United States ambassador to Syria, Robert Ford, and embassy staff are safe after being violently confronted by a pro-regime mob while Ford met with an opposition politician in Damascus, the State Department said Thursday. "A crowd of demonstrators tried to assault Ambassador Ford and Embassy colleagues today as they went about doing the normal [...]

item.title: Dozens arrested in drug raid at Boeing plant
item.description: Federal agents raided a Boeing plant that makes military helicopters in suburban Philadelphia on Thursday and charged more than three dozen people with distributing or trying to get prescription drugs, among them powerful painkillers.
item.media:text: Federal agents raided a Boeing plant that makes military helicopters in suburban Philadelphia on Thursday and charged more than three dozen people with distributing or trying to get prescription drugs, among them powerful painkillers.

item.title: McCain leads senate delegation to Libya
item.description: He may not be an expert on Libya, but John McCain knows this much: Constantly firing guns in the air is no way to get people comfortable with their new government. That was part of the senator's advice to the interim authority there, which he praised on Thursday along with the Libyan people, in the first visit to Tripoli by members of Congress since Col. Muammar Qaddafi fell last month. The senator landed in Tripoli on Thursday as the leader of a delegation that included senators Marco Rubio of Florida, Lindsey Graham of South Carolina and Mark Kirk of Illinois, according to CNN. ...
item.media:text: He may not be an expert on Libya, but John McCain knows this much: Constantly firing guns in the air is no way to get people comfortable with their new government. That was part of the senator's advice to the interim authority there, which he praised on Thursday along with the Libyan people, in the first visit to Tripoli by members of Congress since Col. Muammar Qaddafi fell last month. The senator landed in Tripoli on Thursday as the leader of a delegation that included senators Marco Rubio of Florida, Lindsey Graham of South Carolina and Mark Kirk of Illinois, according to CNN. ...

item.title: The Chris Christie tease
item.description: Lois Romano on why the N.J. governor’s dropped the proclamations that he’s not ready to be president.
item.media:text: Lois Romano on why the N.J. governor’s dropped the proclamations that he’s not ready to be president.

item.title: Bank of America to charge debit card use fee
item.description: (Reuters) - Bank of America Corp plans to charge customers who use their debit cards to make purchases a $5 monthly fee beginning early next year, joining other banks scrambling for new sources of revenue.
item.media:text: (Reuters) - Bank of America Corp plans to charge customers who use their debit cards to make purchases a $5 monthly fee beginning early next year, joining other banks scrambling for new sources of revenue.

item.title: Census: Hispanics fuel US white population growth
item.description: In a twist to notions of race identity, new 2010 census figures show an unexpected reason behind a renewed growth in the U.S. white population: more Hispanics listing themselves as white in the once-a-decade government count.

item.title: Fresh clashes, explosions rock Yemeni capital
item.description: Heavy gunfire and explosions rocked the Yemeni capital on Thursday as clashes between government troops and rival tribesmen erupted anew Thursday, leaving at least three people dead.
item.media:text: Heavy gunfire and explosions rocked the Yemeni capital on Thursday as clashes between government troops and rival tribesmen erupted anew Thursday, leaving at least three people dead.

item.title: Exclusive: Justice Department probing Chinese accounting
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Justice Department is investigating accounting irregularities at Chinese companies listed on U.S. stock exchanges, said an official with the Securities and Exchange Commission, suggesting criminal charges may be brought in addition to civil proceedings.

item.title: Defense: Knox 'crucified' in the media
item.description: A defense lawyer argued Thursday that Amanda Knox was an innocent girl "crucified" in the media, as a judge said the highly anticipated verdict in the appeals trial of the American student convicted of murdering her roommate would come Monday.
item.media:text: A defense lawyer argued Thursday that Amanda Knox was an innocent girl "crucified" in the media, as a judge said the highly anticipated verdict in the appeals trial of the American student convicted of murdering her roommate would come Monday.

item.title: Police: Wife threatened banks to hide money woes
item.description: A Connecticut woman who hid unemployment and money troubles from her husband for nearly a year phoned in bomb threats to banks and an insurance company to prevent him from asking questions, police said. She was arrested when an officer recognized her from a surveillance video he viewed while tracking one of the threats.
item.media:text: A Connecticut woman who hid unemployment and money troubles from her husband for nearly a year phoned in bomb threats to banks and an insurance company to prevent him from asking questions, police said. She was arrested when an officer recognized her from a surveillance video he viewed while tracking one of the threats.

item.title: Judge says Alabama may check students’ immigration status
item.description: U.S. District Judge Sharon Blackburn sided with the state of Alabama on Wednesday on two key sections of the state's wide-ranging crackdown on illegal immigrants. Blackburn refused to enjoin a law that will compel elementary and secondary school administrators to demand students provide birth certificates to prove they were born in the United States, and [...]

item.title: Ron Paul’s Republican problem
item.description: Texas Rep. Ron Paul is the most enigmatic figure in the Republican race for president.

item.title: Twitter reflects world's changing moods
item.description: THURSDAY, Sept. 29 (HealthDay News) -- Using Twitter to track people's moods from every corner of the globe, new research suggests that folks seem to awaken in good cheer and get grumpier as the workday progresses, regardless of where they live.

item.title: 3 industries where workers are most likely to smoke
item.description: People who work in the mining industry are more likely to smoke than workers in any other industry in the U.S., according to a report released today (Sept. 29) by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

item.title: Trump casino offers $25K plastic surgery prize
item.description: The latest casino promotion in Atlantic City gives new meaning to "going bust."
item.media:text: The latest casino promotion in Atlantic City gives new meaning to "going bust."

item.title: Fox’s Conrad Murray trial app already top-ranked in the App Store
item.description: HLN isn't the only major media operation looking to tap public interest in the Conrad Murray trial for a shot of ratings. Fox Television has launched a mobile application dedicated to the case against Michael Jackson's doctor. The 99-cent app--available for both Android and Apple devices--features live-streaming coverage of the trial via KTTV 11, Fox's [...]

item.title: Earthlike Planets May Be Less Common than We Think
item.description: Unless searchers who scan the cosmic airwaves pick up signals from extraterrestrials, the discovery for life on other planets will take a while, and it will take a series of incremental steps. Step one - making sure there are planets outside of our solar system in the first place - has long since been accomplished. Thanks to searches from the ground and, more recently, by the orbiting Kepler spacecraft, astronomers know that hundreds of planets, at the very least, orbit other stars, and almost certainly far more than that.

item.title: Students in early classes get better grades: study
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Given the chance most university students would opt to schedule late classes so they can sleep longer but new research shows pupils who take early classes are more likely to get higher grades.

item.title: Mass. cat with 2 faces lives 12 years, sets record
item.description: Frank and Louie the cat was born with two faces, two mouths, two noses, three eyes — and lots of doubts about his future.
item.media:text: Frank and Louie the cat was born with two faces, two mouths, two noses, three eyes — and lots of doubts about his future.

item.title: Could model airplanes become a terrorist weapon?
item.description: Model airplanes are suddenly on the public's radar as potential terrorist weapons.

item.title: US-led coalition: Afghan insurgent attacks falling
item.description: International forces in Afghanistan released new data Thursday showing violence trending downward in their favor, only a day after the U.N. reported considerably more clashes and other attacks per month than last year.
item.media:text: International forces in Afghanistan released new data Thursday showing violence trending downward in their favor, only a day after the U.N. reported considerably more clashes and other attacks per month than last year.

item.title: Gingrich calls for changes in taxes, health care
item.description: Hoping to revive his flagging bid for the Republican presidential nomination, former House Speaker Newt Gingrich is calling for an overhaul of the way Americans pay taxes, buy health care and contribute to the Social Security system.

item.title: AP Exclusive: US fugitive lived openly in Africa
item.description: An American fugitive who once hijacked a plane lived openly in the West African nation of Guinea-Bissau during the 1980s under his real name and even knew U.S. embassy officials there, a former U.S. ambassador said Thursday.
item.media:text: An American fugitive who once hijacked a plane lived openly in the West African nation of Guinea-Bissau during the 1980s under his real name and even knew U.S. embassy officials there, a former U.S. ambassador said Thursday.

item.title: Defense: Amanda Knox 'crucified' in Italy's media
item.description: An Italian defense lawyer argued Thursday that Amanda Knox is an innocent girl "crucified" in the media and wrongly convicted of killing her roommate, urging an appeals court not to be afraid to correct a mistake.
item.media:text: An Italian defense lawyer argued Thursday that Amanda Knox is an innocent girl "crucified" in the media and wrongly convicted of killing her roommate, urging an appeals court not to be afraid to correct a mistake.

item.title: Al-Qaida rejects Iran's 9/11 conspiracy theories
item.description: Al-Qaida has sharply criticized Iran's president over his suggestions that the United States government was behind the Sept. 11 attacks and not al-Qaida, dismissing the comments as "ridiculous."

item.title: Recovery next year for world stocks: poll
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - World stock markets will recover next year from a nightmarish 2011 that has wiped trillions of dollars off share prices, according to a Reuters poll that showed almost all major stock indexes ending 2011 in the red.

item.title: Jobless claims, GDP data ease economic fears
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The chances of the U.S. economy averting a new recession got a boost on Thursday with claims for jobless benefits falling to a five-month low last week and growth a touch stronger in the second quarter than previously estimated.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The chances of the U.S. economy averting a new recession got a boost on Thursday with claims for jobless benefits falling to a five-month low last week and growth a touch stronger in the second quarter than previously estimated.

item.title: Libya's NTC retakes airport in Gaddafi home town
item.description: SIRTE, Libya (Reuters) - Libyan interim government forces recaptured the airport in Sirte, Muammar Gaddafi's birthplace, on Thursday, amid mounting concern for civilians trapped inside the besieged city.
item.media:text: SIRTE, Libya (Reuters) - Libyan interim government forces recaptured the airport in Sirte, Muammar Gaddafi's birthplace, on Thursday, amid mounting concern for civilians trapped inside the besieged city.

item.title: Exclusive: Justice Department probing Chinese accounting
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Justice Department is investigating accounting irregularities at Chinese companies listed on U.S. stock exchanges, said an official with the Securities and Exchange Commission, suggesting criminal charges may be brought in addition to civil proceedings.

item.title: SEC concedes challenges in credit-rating probes
item.description: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - The Securities and Exchange Commission faces hurdles proving wrongdoing at credit-rating agencies, the agency's enforcement chief said, pointing to the complexity of the cases and the industry's strong legal defenses.
item.media:text: WASHINGTON/NEW YORK (Reuters) - The Securities and Exchange Commission faces hurdles proving wrongdoing at credit-rating agencies, the agency's enforcement chief said, pointing to the complexity of the cases and the industry's strong legal defenses.

item.title: Analysis: Stagnant U.S. jobs market bodes ill for world economy
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - Record-high long-term unemployment is testing politicians and central bankers to the utmost as the impact of a shortfall in demand is amplified by an aging population, a mismatch of skills and inadequate efforts to get people back to work.
item.media:text: LONDON (Reuters) - Record-high long-term unemployment is testing politicians and central bankers to the utmost as the impact of a shortfall in demand is amplified by an aging population, a mismatch of skills and inadequate efforts to get people back to work.
